info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 10:19PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Louisa, Cumberland, east central Prince Edward, northwestern Nottoway, Goochland, northwestern Hanover, Amelia, Powhatan and Fluvanna Counties through 1115 PM EDT... At 1018 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles southeast of Stanardsville to near Burkeville. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Powhatan, Goochland, Cumberland, Crewe, Louisa, Mineral, Palmyra, Fork Union, Hadensville, Amelia Courthouse, Cartersville, Tuckahoe, Lake Monticello, Burkeville, Columbia, Gum Spring, Oilville, Manakin, Ferncliff and Tobaccoville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for central and south central Virginia.
